snippet: A dream project of Bertrand Delanoë, the Socialist mayor of Paris, to reduce car traffic along the banks of the Seine has been unblocked by France’s new Socialist government.
abstract: Mayor Bertrand Delanoe of Paris has begun moving ahead with a long-deferred plan to reduce car traffic along the banks of the Seine, rezoning the areas for pedestrian and bicycle traffic; long-standing block on the project was lifted by Prime Minister Jean-Marc Ayrault following the fall of Nicolas Sarkozy's center-right party.
lead_paragraph: A dream project of Bertrand Delanoë, the Socialist mayor of Paris, to reduce car traffic along the banks of the Seine has been unblocked by France’s new Socialist government.

headline.seo: Paris to Cut Car Traffic Along the Seine
headline.main: With Block Lifted, Paris to Cut Vehicle Traffic Along the Seine
headline.print_headline: With Block Lifted, Paris to Cut Vehicle Traffic Along the Seine
